comments:
The XSDParser (part of the XSD support shipped with Ecore/SDO) does
some work with classloaders in its constructor. In some contexts thi results 
in a security exception.

java.security.AccessControlException: access denied 
(java.lang.RuntimePermission setContextClassLoader)
       at java.security.AccessControlContext.checkPermission
(AccessControlContext.java(Compiled Code))
       at java.security.AccessController.checkPermission(AccessController.java
(Compiled Code))
       at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPermission(SecurityManager.java
(Compiled Code))
       at com.ibm.ws.security.core.SecurityManager.checkPermission
(SecurityManager.java(Compiled Code))
       at java.lang.Thread.setContextClassLoader(Thread.java:1249)
       at org.eclipse.xsd.util.XSDParser.<init>(XSDParser.java:174)
       at org.eclipse.xsd.util.XSDResourceImpl.doLoad(XSDResourceImpl.java:384)
       at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceImpl.load
(ResourceImpl.java:867)
       at com.ibm.ws.sib.mfp.sdo.repository.XSDResourceLoader.loadSchema
(XSDResourceLoader.java:176)
       at 
com.ibm.ws.sib.mfp.sdo.repository.SdoRepositoryCache.loadSchemaResource
(SdoRepositoryCache.java:474)
       at com.ibm.ws.sib.mfp.sdo.repository.SdoRepositoryCache.loadResource
(SdoRepositoryCache.java:456)
       at com.ibm.ws.sib.mfp.sdo.repository.SdoRepositoryCache.getEcoreModel
(SdoRepositoryCache.java:261)


Can this constructor be changed so that it doesn't need to fiddle with the 
classloader?
The fix to remove the unnecessary code has been committed to CVS.
The fix is available in the M200408260844 build.
